title: Understanding Trauma-Informed Care
text: Trauma-Informed Care (TIC) is an approach in healthcare that recognizes the impact of trauma on an individual's life. It involves understanding, recognizing, and responding to the effects of all types of trauma.

title: Key Components of TIC
text: TIC involves creating a safe environment, building trust, and empowering individuals. It acknowledges the widespread impact of trauma and understands potential paths for recovery.

hintAnswer: $$health-care$$ providers acknowledge all past and present parts of a person’s life situation, including any trauma they have endured
title: Identifying the Correct Definition
text: Which of the following best describes trauma-informed care?
choices: $$step-down$$ program for clients who require a higher level of care and support than that offered by outpatient treatment but who do not need $$twenty-four-hour$$ supervision is
